ref: 12307 śamitā f. ʻ rice -- powder ʼ lex., samitā -- f. ʻ wheat flour ʼ Bhpr. (sēvikā -- f. ʻ a kind of vermicelli made of wheat flour and boiled in milk and sugar ʼ BhP.: sanskritization of NIA.?).
Pk. samia -- ʻ a confection made of wheat flour ʼ, samiā -- f. ʻ wheat flour ʼ;
S. sẽī˜ f. ʻ a piece of vermicelli ʼ;
P. sevīã̄, semīã̄ f. pl., seuṇī f. ʻ vermicelli ʼ;
H. sewaī˜, siwaĩ, simaï, samaī f., sẽwiyã̄, siwaiyã̄ f. pl. ʻ vermicelli ʼ;
G. sev, sevaī f. ʻ thread -- like comestible made of flour of chickpeas or wheat ʼ;
M. śev, śevī, śeve f. ʻ a little roll of pulse -- flour ʼ, śevay, pl. śevyā f. ʻ vermicelli ʼ.
